intro: Houstonia linnaei, commonly known as the Linnaean bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tiny, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Houstonia linnaei is often found in association with other woodland wildflowers, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
